description.text: An image of a "Jewellery Shop" from a sample calendar poster from the Empire Calender Manufacturing Co., Calcutta depicting a jewellery shop. Two women are looking at silver ware in a glass showcase while a husband and wife with their child standing next to them are buying something. Another couple are walking away from the shop. An armed guard can be seen to the right of the image standing next to another glass showcase for silver dishware. There are four men behind the counter of the shop- two in front of the couple with the child, one to the right and one to the left.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

ext:item.ext:value: description-en: An image of a "Jewellery Shop" from a sample calendar poster from the Empire Calender Manufacturing Co., Calcutta depicting a jewellery shop. Two women are looking at silver ware in a glass showcase while a husband and wife with their child standing next to them are buying something. Another couple are walking away from the shop. An armed guard can be seen to the right of the image standing next to another glass showcase for silver dishware. There are four men behind the counter of the shop- two in front of the couple with the child, one to the right and one to the left. (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: This is the microcosm of an efficient small business undertaking in a burgeoning urban setting, with a sophisticated and well-educated affluent middle class. The image reminds me of 'an ideal boy' posters, educational charts of 'good civil society', or a diorama in a museum. The space is structured orderly and all is related to 'tamed' consumption and efficiency. There is an accountant wearing a tie and glasses in a back room (top left), on his desk is a bell (to call the peon) and a black phone. Two pink curtains reveal a drawer. Between two turning wall fans and a round glass lamp hang two framed landscape paintings, signs of 'class'. A servant clad in white dhoti and shirt walks towards the front room (top right). The shop is 'modern' in that it has a carpet, display glass cabinets, with assorted goods: gold jewellery features centrally, to the left and the right are silver items for decoration. Two girlfriends gaze at the silver, one wearing glasses and a small handbag, the other resting her left hand on her friend's right shoulder. One couple, looking 'Sindhi'-Punjabi are about to leave the shop. They could also be leaving a temple. The girl child wears a 'doll-like' western dress in pink and blue.() (cb)

This is the microcosm of an efficient small business undertaking in a burgeoning urban setting, with a sophisticated and well-educated affluent middle class. The image reminds me of 'an ideal boy' posters, educational charts of 'good civil society', or a diorama in a museum. The space is structured orderly and all is related to 'tamed' consumption and efficiency. There is an accountant wearing a tie and glasses in a back room (top left), on his desk is a bell (to call the peon) and a black phone. Two pink curtains reveal a drawer. Between two turning wall fans and a round glass lamp hang two framed landscape paintings, signs of 'class'. A servant clad in white dhoti and shirt walks towards the front room (top right). The shop is 'modern' in that it has a carpet, display glass cabinets, with assorted goods: gold jewellery features centrally, to the left and the right are silver items for decoration. Two girlfriends gaze at the silver, one wearing glasses and a small handbag, the other resting her left hand on her friend's right shoulder. One couple, looking 'Sindhi'-Punjabi are about to leave the shop. They could also be leaving a temple. The girl child wears a 'doll-like' western dress in pink and blue.
